item.latestTitle: Making a technical correction to the SFC Sean Cooley and SPC Christopher Horton Congressional Gold Star Family Fellowship Program Act.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.latestTitle: SFC Sean Cooley and SPC Christopher Horton Congressional Gold Star Family Fellowship Program Resolution

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration.

item.latestTitle: Establishing the Congressional Gold Star Fellowship Program for the placement in offices of Members of the House of Representatives of children, spouses, and siblings of members of the Armed Forces who are hostile casualties or who have died from a training-related injury.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

item.text: The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H8580)
Passed/agreed to in House: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.(text: CR H8580)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H8585)

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Davis, Rodney objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 107.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H8580-8583)
Ms. Lofgren moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

SFC Sean Cooley and SPC Christopher Horton Congressional Gold Star Family Fellowship Program Act

This resolution establishes in the House of Representatives the Congressional Gold Star Family Fellowship Program under which certain family members of a member of the Armed Forces who is a hostile casualty or died from a training-related injury may serve a 12-month fellowship in the office of a Member of the House.
item.name: Introduced in House

item.text:
SFC Sean Cooley and SPC Christopher Horton Congressional Gold Star Family Fellowship Program Act

This resolution establishes in the House of Representatives the Congressional Gold Star Family Fellowship Program under which certain family members of deceased members of the Armed Forces or deceased veterans may serve a 12-month fellowship in the office of a Member of the House.
item.name: Passed House

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
